page.title: 09WOOTTON FARM
page.content: The farm supports a family of 5,the grandfather(working) and a relief milker. The Quance family have owned it since 1840, having purchased it from the Fortescue Estate.There are 90 acres with another 200 nearby. Dairy cattle(Friesians), calves, two bulls and breeding ewes are kept.Pigs were kept until 10 years ago but became unprofitable. In summer cattle are out at grass, in winter housed in barns.Milk is collected by tankers from the Torrington milk factory.Stock is bought and sold at Holsworthy market. Grass is the main crop.Barley is grown.Weeds are controlled by chemicals and artificial fertilizers used. A barn was destroyed by fire two years ago.
